content:
Posted: March 16, 2016
												After years of developping still there is no save option for mission so players can not built more complicated missions or campagins. There is no dynamic campaginIf you wana to have fun with formation flying things like that buy it. If you count that you  can play complicated missions, capturing towns, airfields, something like battlefield or ARMA but on simulation level (what would be nice), dont buy it. Because nobody has not made such a mission on campagin but it is posible to make-devs dont care about itIts a good game, nice looking, phisics is also on very good level you need to spend some teens of hours to learn how to fly and fight that is realy nice. Almost everything is very good here except of one thing.Digital Combat Simulator can not simulate big military operations, MMO etc. It offers tanks, artilaery, planes, helicopters, ships, AWACS, EWR, AA and many many more + posibility to take comand over vehicles/groups or even drive them but for what? there is no dynamic campagin. In multipalyer guys has crafted some good missions but they are concentrated mostly on PVPing on air than on gound that cooperation (but it should be opposite because it real planes only support military operations but the most important ground forces are). DCS has few misions built in, if you want more you have mission editor, then everything you have to built self!!!  If you got bored of PVPing or formation flying then you have to become a GAME DEVELOPER and spend thousends of hours to create good mission/campagin to play (like me, I spend more time in editor than in air/ground). To built something good on good level you need to spend houndreds of hours to create mission, I will not tell about dynamic campagin (some thousends hours). Developpers dont planing to make online dynamic campagin (join/leave when you want and choose automaticly generated mission to do in online campagin) but it is posible to create it but they prefer to create new modules for $ then something what is missing for years here. just look here:over 100 pages...answer from ED? IS not posible due to overstress of PC. It is posible when you make deactivating object witch are not necesery now (players are far). I have implemented over 200 groups and over 4100 objects. Its working. 4200 is unstable.In my opinion, Its beter for devs to produce more modules for not finished " DCS wrold", because its easier and faster to do, than realy needed stuff like dynamic campagin.P.S dont tell devs that DCS has not been thought throught well...you will get BANNED :D

number of helpful: 16 of 63 people (25%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: October 16, 2014
												At first look this game looks amazing, looks like the ultimate flying simulator for flying simulator fans.the graphics looks amazingly detailed and high quality.The controls are are detaild down to the cockpit lights, and the opening and closing of the cockpity roof.At first look this game looks incradible... that is until you find out the amout BUGS in this game.Game haulting bugs, and bad UX. for example: when trying to finish the tutorials (without them you wont be able to play the game), if you restart the tutorial, the tutorial will get stuck on the instruction. which will make you close the game trough Windows , since there is no other way to close the game when in mission, making you frustrated from all the long loading times you have to go trough. every time you start a mission at the main menu, the game completly shutsdow and opens up the mission instance, i have no idea why they did that like that, but that makes loading time 3x the normal loading times for this kinda game. eventually i was tired of waiting in loading screen, and tired of exiting and entering the game, so i had to uninstall. I have to say i looked up the solution for the game haulting bugs of this game, and saw no reffence to them except some QA employees telling other people who experienced these bugs that "we couldn't replicate it on our computers" excuse, you know... "it worked on my computer". that just show the indifferance of the developers to bugs in the game.To bad because what could have been maybe the best flight simulator for PC is complitly unplayable due to inefficent QA and bug solving.All in all - potentially a great game, unplayble due to bugs, long loading times, and bad UX.I give it 3 out 10 (beacuse of the bugs otherwise it would get an 8 or 9)

number of helpful: 1 of 26 people (4%) found this review helpful5 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: December 27, 2015
												I downloaded DCS world earlier today, it took a long time to download (around 11 hours) but i was excited to play it because of all of the positive reviews on the store page and because i enjoy plane simulator games. However, after the long wait, i was ready to play the game i had wanted for quite a while, but never had a good enough computer to play, this christmas i bought an NVIDIA GTX 750 TI so that i could run more games on PC, i was excited to play and opened DCS world for the first time, straight away, a small black window, a console window, appeared, after a few seconds it vanished and the game booted up, i adjusted the resolution and put the game onto highest settings, loaded up the free flight mode and then, i was kicked out of the game onto the desktop, after a while it loaded back up and loaded free flight, it kept doing the same thing, once i decided to wait and eventually, free flight loaded.i couldn't wait to play, i tried to turn the plane, and it went spiralling out of control into the poorly designed, two-dimensional, badly rendered textures of the ground, the plane then exploded. i waited, the game never respawned me, instead i was taken to an airport ingame, and forced to watch a random aeroplane sit still, i tried moving the mouse, pressing keys etc. but nothing would happen, i pressed on Esc and clicked on quit, i was kicked out of the game again for a while, then my entire desktop went black for 5 minutes, i pressed Ctrl+Alt+Delete but DCS would not close, it eventually loaded the game again, and it crashed instantly.I rate this game 7.5/10, not enough black screens

Then post on their forums about critique and you will soon be banned. zthey take years to develop new things, this is because they dont have any competition out there, if they did there would be a little more sense of urgency in their work and how they treat their customers. They have 3rd Party Devs that create modules and never release manuals for them (Belsimtek), then they expect you to learn by flying it...really! Its a nice sim but not worth to buy modules full price, they have sales once a quarter, if you do want to give in them get the modules when they are 75% off.

content:
Posted: November 2, 2015
												This is a complicated enough game that tutorials are pretty necesary.  I've played complicated sims before like Kamov Hokum, but each has it's own level of detail for targeting/controls so you pretty much need to learn each sim.The problem is the tutorials are broken.  The spacebar is used to proceed through the tutorial, but even with the default key mapping I enver changed, it does not work.  Googling found lots of other people with same problem.  I finally found a key mapping that managed to get the tutorial to start, but then later it froze again and nothing I did would get it to proceed.  Seems like the tutorial, something that is very linear, should be easily testable with default control settings, but apperently even after numerous reports from users, they haven't bothered fixing it.

number of helpful: 4 of 34 people (12%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: April 17, 2016
												I downloaded and attempted to run this game with the occulus rift.Boy was that a mistake.The menu and HUD ignore head tracking, so you can't rebind any of your keys, or even see what they are already bound to because your eyeballs are not meant to see and read text at the very top of your vision. You were meant to move your head so that it enters your field of view.The game itself is completely unplayable in VR. Everything has its own complicated keybinding ( Ctrl + Shift + Del = turn on power, F5 + num9 + roll your face on the left half of the keyboard is turn power off) I'm sure plenty of basement dwellers enjoy that kind of immersion but it is COMPLETELY IMPOSSIBLE while you are wearing a VR headset.Why?Because you cannot see the keyboard to execute the overly complicated commands.Duh.Maybe this is a revolution in gaming. I will never know. Don't bother with this if you were hoping for an engaging VR experience.

number of helpful: 12 of 54 people (22%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: December 5, 2014
												Be very careful what add ons you pay for, as some are way overpriced. UH-1H is awesome. It has tutorials and a campaign. It was a little overpriced as it did not come with any unique maps. I got it on sale so it's been well worth the price.F-86 on the other hand was a complete rip off. Even on sale at $30 it was overpriced. It is the plane. That's it. No tutorials, no maps, and no campaign. I think there are 6 missions. I notice the WWII planes are the same which is why I haven't bought any. Until DCS offers free maps, tutorials, and campaigns like with some of the other planes at the same price DON'T buy. Total rip off. It's to bad because there is some huge potential. Get IL-2 if you want WWII planes. Cliff's of Dover with mods is great. Battle of Stalingrad is still lacking a true campaign mode but is still far better than DCS with nothing. If I could I would give DCS both a thumbs up, for the modules they have done right and a huge thumbs down for the rip offs that they have release of late.
